hobby.message: Urban exploration still your kind of therapy?
Still chasing ghosts with analog photography?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Systems are always twitchy now. Nothing stable out there.
I fly drones after hours to unwind sometimes.
Markets and gatherings shook up patrol patterns, makes night flights trickier.
That's all.
They've been more unpredictable since the leak. Routing's off everywhere.
I do some FPV drone flying where I can.
Last week got interrupted by new crowds—Memory Market types crowding open space.
Makes flying less private than before.
Not sure it's safe to keep it up.
Yeah, the system’s a mess these days, even outside work.
I fly first-person drones after hours, old habit from school.
Cargo yards used to be deserted. Now I dodge crowds trading memory scraps.
Last night I picked up chatter on the feed, almost clipped a gathering.
It’s harder to slip off-grid without running into someone now.
But I’m not stopping. Yet.
Jumpy is putting it mildly. Most processes glitch if you even blink fast.
I fly freestyle FPV drones off-grid—industrial sites, transmissions off most logging devices.
Used to be quiet; now Market people turn up everywhere, sharing handwritten junk.
Almost flew straight into a story circle last week, got flagged in the app too.
My BCI’s bleeding points for nothing, just proximity to 'noncompliant' zones.
Missing the days when I could fly for hours alone.
Guess nothing stays open and simple anymore.
They’re unstable—algorithms stumble since Halden’s mess. Even leisure threads trigger system alerts now.
My hobby’s FPV drone flying—close circuit, manual feed, everything off-grid as possible.
Mapped the southern yards for fun. These days, Memory Market crowds swarm my flight spots.
It’s not just a hobby. Used to help my brother escape city tracking, back before he disappeared.
Every session now is riskier, more flagged, more public than I want.
My BCI score slipped again, not even for a real violation—just 'proximity risk.'
Sometimes I bank around a new gathering and spot people trying to archive lost stories. I record a little, erase my trail, hope it’s enough.
Honestly, flying used to make me invisible. Now I can’t shake the sense I’m too visible, even doing what clears my head.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Still manage a few flights sometimes.
Not as easy since everything started shifting.
That Memory Market stuff draws too many out now.
Mostly keep to safe spots, low and quick.
Not much else to say.
Yeah, I still fly when I can.
It’s tougher with all the new crowds showing up.
Memory Markets pull people into the old zones now.
Makes things more exposed. Less anonymous for flying.
Scanners pick up more signals lately.
I just stick with short flights.
Yeah, FPV is still my go-to.
Clears my head, you know.
The city’s not as predictable after those Memory Markets started.
Used to have the yards to myself... now it’s full of people trading stories.
I have to scout more, avoid the obvious times.
Saw a few faces watching me last week.
Almost missed the open air I liked.
Yeah, flying FPV is still the only way I can reset.
Whole class of new folks near the old shipping lots since the Memory Markets blew up.
Saw them exchanging diaries, even heard reading—never used to be that open.
Now, I have to run short flights or risk unwanted attention.
Some people recognize the sound, watch my moves.
My BCI score dropped again after one of those nights.
Feels like the system tracks even what clears my head now.
Sort of makes it more intense, not always in a good way.
Yeah, I still fly, but it’s changed lately.
Started back when the old districts were ghost zones.
Could take hours, just weaving between columns, staying invisible.
Now the Memory Markets are everywhere—people gathering for things the system erased.
It’s strange hearing laughter in places that used to be silent.
Once, a group waved at my quad mid-flight—never happened before.
I caught a bit of their stories on my goggles, saved it out-of-band, just in case.
My BCI score flagged almost right after. System’s picking up trace signals, even hobbies now.
Makes me feel exposed every time I go up, but I still have to do it.
